title: Quality of care.
body: I cannot fault the car given by staff on Ward 5B even though they were obviously understaffed & under considerable pressure. Also the building is very tired & doesn't help with the experience. Some of the bed functions did not work which didn't help. But a big thank you to the staff.

title: Outstanding Team
body:
We contacted ICT and their input commenced with a timely assessment of mums needs. Essentially, she had gone ‘off her feet’, unable to get up out of bed, and unable to tell us why as she cannot speak ( following a stroke 7yrs prior).
At 84 mum was desperate to avoid going into hospital where she was afraid she would be unable to communicate her needs, she wanted to stay in her home to rehabilitate and recover. 
The Intermediate Care Team have provided at home an outstanding team of professional carers ,Physios & OT’s & nurses, all of whom have consistently supported a great outcome. ICT helped divert from hospital admission, preventing the development of pressure sores, and preventing infection through their vigilant observations, dignified personal care and guidance to family on how best to help and care too. 
We have received (and collected to assist)  specialist equipment including a hospital bed, wheeled commode and moboard. We have had support in training our family to use the equipment to safely transfer mum and continue to care for her at home.
The team have brought such a positive approach, and an energy and enthusiasm that has really built-up mums confidence and motivation. Their skills and professionalism has guided us forwards through the challenges of the last 5wks. 

The family are mindful this wonderful care has all been against a backdrop of particularly high demand on the NHS and ICT services, given the volume of patients being admitted and discharged from hospital and the crisis of recruitment to care and of course the pandemic. We appreciate how physically and emotionally demanding this specialist care work is and want to say thank you so very much for your kindness and all that you have done for us and all that you are doing to help other people in need across the county.

title: First class experience
body: three day stay-- excellent treatment from all staff during my stay and through after care.Would always recommend this hospital to anybody needing knee replacement.

title: Just the right blend of professionalism and…
body: Extremely well organised and efficient process, friendly and enjoyable. Personable staff from parking through to administration, vaccination and beyond. Thank you all very much.

title: Great care
body: We received world-class care at Kingston A&E last night when our son was admitted via ambulance with severe blood loss. From the nurses and registrars who worked to stabilise him to the paramedics who transerred him with such care by ambulance to St George's. All were brilliant. There was a slight delay matching his bloods for transfusion,  but they were able to use a universally accepted blood - O Neg - and that did the job. Everyone's kindness and sympathy moved us greatly. Thank you.

title: Excellent treatment
body: I attended the A & E Department and my suspected condition was proved correct also immediately. All necessary investigations were done quickly and a plan of treatment produced. I left A& E and was transferred to a Cardiology Ward until discharge the following day. At all times I was treated professionally and with great empathy and nothing was too much for the staff. THANK YOU ALL

title: Excellent service
body: I am very impressed with the patient care I have received from all the staff at Mansion House Surgery. From several phone consultations through to a face to face appointment today, I have been shown kindness, dedication & compassion…particularly impressive given the difficult circumstances of the last 18 months. I would like to extend my heartfelt thanks to the reception staff and all the medical staff for their sterling work. Thank you all

title: Brilliant Service
body: Our whole family is with Honeypot Medical health Centre. We always have had brilliant service with minimal waiting times! My sick mother in law who is 90 year old is always served and referred immediately for any health problems. The reception staff are polite and helpful

title: Exceptional successful visit
body:
I couldn't be more satisfied with the audiology treatment and service I had from the Longton Specsavers Branch.  Due to the Covid situation, I needed an overdue wax removal. 
 The patience, professionalism and expertise during the successful procedure caused me to exclaim "Oh joy".  After seeing how solid the removed wax was, I was even more grateful and relieved.  Also I now I don't have the 'whoosh, whoosh in my ears during the night.

title: Superb service
body: This is in my view a really outstanding GP practice.  In my last visit I was brought in for a same day injection of my hip by the duty doctor.  Within a week or two it settled.  This morning I phoned to arrange a blood test.  Reception staff polite, professional and understanding.  OK there was a wait to get through but hugely better than any other service I could name.  COVID vaccination response was superb.  Every doctor I have seen has been outstanding with real professionalism, skill and kindness.  Praise where it’s due.  Thank you all so much.

title: 19th November 2021 appointment
body:
Would like to express my sincere thanks to the reception ladies on duty this morning for the wonderful help they gave me so I could see a Doctor face to face today.Also to the Doctor who was very thorough and kind. I left the surgery feeling much relived. 
Once again thank you so much.

title: Friendly caring team a great service
body: My daughter was unwell and needing to see a GP, the receptionist was friendly and helpful, the GP was so caring and kind, the pharmacy team very helpful and fast, thank you for helping my daughter I really appreciate everything you have done to aid her recovery

title: amazing after care and service
body: I was offered a telephone appointment at short notice and told by the GP to go straight in.  He saw me immediately. The next day, he rang me to check how I was doing.  incredible service.

title: Thank You - Covid / Flu Home Visit
body: Can I say a massive thanks to the nurse and to Skelmanthorpe Family Doctors for visiting my housebound Father and vaccinating him for Covid & Flu at home. The nurse was professional, caring and lovely and the visit was very much appreciated, especially during these extremely difficult times. Thank you once again to everyone involved, especially the nurse.

title: So frustrating
body: Struggle to get appointments can never get same day always at least a 2 week wait certain reception staff are really rude and unhelpful it never used to be like this

title: Fantastic service
body: I was sent to A and E on my doctors advise and although it was extremely busy the staff were all amazing. Very friendly, reassuring and quick service . Thank you all

title: Superb
body: Our son received superb care from the staff in A&E. He was losing a lot of blood after a cancer operation the previous week.  It was late at night.  The treatment he received from everybody in the A&E team at St George's was first-rate. They were calm,  kind, compassionate and so skilled. A team from the Maxillo-facial department, headed by an eminent consultant, took over the case immediately. They explained everything very clearly, and by 3am my son was in the operating theatre.   It was all so impressive. World class.  Thank you.

title: Caring staff
body: Have received the most attentive care from every GP at this practice, especially over the last few weeks. Despite seeing various different doctors, it is clear that they have communicated well between themselves as well as with other agencies. The receptionists have been kind, respectful and welcoming too.

title: Awful practice
body: Honestly, hand on heart this is an awfully run gp practice the receptionists are unwelcoming and uninformative. They show no empathy towards anyone. They do not acknowledge you when you are waiting at the front desk. The appointment system is a shambles and does not work. They did not send any information regarding the new changes to the appointment system. I think they need to hire new front of house staff as the staff they currently have are facety.

title: Poor service
body: I called about 6 times to get to a specific secretary and all 6 times was unsuccessful, even on an occasion I was told that she's isn't in, later on the same day I was told that she was in the time I called and I missed her. Poor service by reception staff and I am starting to lose trust.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I attended the breast care department on 17/11/2021. I was extremely nervous but the staff were wonderful. They explained everything fully and treated me like an intelligent human being and with great kindness and compassion. I left full of confidence and feeling cared for - I really cannot praise them enough. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: So friendly and professional. This is the best surgery I have ever attended. Each member of staff that I have met has been thorough and most helpful.

title: Poor practice
body: I feel ignored by my GP and the surgery staff. None of them respond to my requests for the letter I am waiting for. There is a deafening silence on this matter. It seems no one is going to deal with this matter and that is very important to me.

title: Fantastic friendly staff
body: I was sent to the Early Pregnancy Unit late one evening and because I wasn’t an emergency I had to wait for the doctors from labour ward to come and see me. The nurse who was in the Early Pregnancy Unit called the car parking people for me so that I wasn’t fined for my ticket expiring and she lent me a phone charger as, being non urgent and with it being late in the evening, I had a long wait. She kept me informed as to where things were at in terms of how busy the doctors were. I felt so welcome and well looked after and like asking for things like where I could get water or to sort my parkung out was no trouble. I’m so pleased I have chosen Darlington to have my baby.

title: Receptionists are condescending
body: I’m a new patient at this surgery, so I haven’t visited the doctors but I have to say, the receptionists have been quite condescending the couple of times, I have spoken to them on the phone and the communication haven’t been great or accurate.  According to the surgery’s website, you have to have a new patient check, if you’re on regular medication but when I called to ask for one, I was told that the surgery didn’t do new patient checks. When I called some days later to ask which pharmacy my prescriptions had been sent to, the receptionist stated the wrong pharmacy, so when I turned up at the pharmacy, they hadn’t received my prescriptions. It turned out they had been sent to my old pharmacy in Bristol.

title: Excellent experience at Colchester Hospital
body:
I was diagnosed with breast cancer at the end of September this year, and by the 19 November my cancer has been completely dealt with and I have been discharged.  

Through the whole process I could not find any fault whatsoever with how I have been dealt with and will be forever thankful to the surgeons, diagnostic staff, radiographers, radiologists, oncologists and support staff.  Not only did they save my life, they were so professional, efficient and capable that I had no worry at any point in the process.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonder people
body: Excellent throughout, everyone at the practice were helpful, kind and very professional. Many many Thanks in this trying time.

title: Florence nightingale ward
body: having had a full knee replacement on 15/11/21 ,i have nothing but praise for all staff involved ,from the cleaner to the surgeons, would like to thank them all for there professional and caring attitude ,made my stay easier than expected

title: brilliant organisation
body: My wife and I attended the surgery for our annual flu jabs, along with many others. The way the flu jabs were organised was exceptional resulting in a continual flow of patients receiving their jabs. There was no rush, no or very little waiting for the injections. Both my wife and myself were greatly impressed. Well done Leiston surgery (again - the same excellent organisation for the COVID jabs last January and March in the Sizewell Club)

title: Excellent practice
body: Efficient, friendly, punctual. All went well. Very pleased. I've had all my injections with no problems.

title: Speedy Jab
body: Brilliantly organised flu jabs this morning. Fast, efficient and good-natured. My thanks to everybody involved.

title: Disorganised and Unavailable
body:
Incorrect prescriptions sent to Pharmacy twice in succession at my cost.
Cannot get through to prescription queries by phone, loops back through to main menu.
Incorrect information passed on by receptionist.
Online services cannot connect to NHS app to obtain COVID passport and reply was ‘people keep asking us about this and we have no idea’.
This place is utterly disorganised.

title: Booster
body: Well organized system felt safe. Short wait outside. Jan itself ok given good information. More information could have been given at time of booking

title: Brilliant service
body: Both recently and throughout the Co-vid problem this surgery has given an excellent service to my wife and I. Telephone appointments have been on time and complete with all the information we required and now face to face visits are back these have been provided without question or delay. All the staff are efficient, helpful and have a 'no problem' attitude delivered with a smile. I like that! I have been able to repay their efficiency and kindness with the odd packet of chocolate biscuits but this has been a small reward for the great service.

title: Covid Booster Jab
body:
Very well organised.
Cannot fault the service provided.
Staff and doctors informative and helpful.
Would definitely recommend.

title: Cataract surgery
body: Very efficient service from start to finish Very efficient staff from start to finish would definitely recommend

title: Wasted Visit
body:
My 13 year old daughter was booked in to Walton Hospital for her vaccine today. She'd had a positive PCR at the end of September, but we had since received an NHS letter to say it was okay to book the vaccine as 28 days had passed. She was very anxious about the needle, and this is why we opted not to be vaccinated at school. 
On arrival she was very tearful in the queue, but understood the importance of the process. However, we were refused entry.   The volunteer told us the guidance had changed and she now needed to be 12 weeks post Covid. This is not great for her well being. She was also very annoyed when she heard a school friend, who'd had Covid at the same time, was permitted the vaccine. Why did the system not notify us of the change to prevent further anxiety and in addition prevent wasted time!

title: Great experience
body: I have read all the negative reviews and understand that getting an appointment can be difficult. I have just had my booster and flu jab. It could not have been a better experience. Every point of contact was great, from the smile at the greeting to the lady who administered the jab. A great job for a vital service at the end of a tough couple of years - thank you. You are appreciated.

title: Nothing is to much hassle
body: Doctor phone and within hour and half had seen the doctor face to face and referred to a specialist for test without any issues and always someone there to speak to about any issue you may have

title: Excellent practise
body: Very organised surgery.  Everyone is very helpful and friendly.  Always able to get appointments and treatment needed.

title: Excellent service
body: Paramedics who came to see me were absolutely the best! Kind, understanding, professional. They were patient with listening to me as I lost my ability to talk with sense. Thank you so much for your service!

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

title: Terrible
body:
Tried making an appointment but the receptionist said to use their app, so I try to use the app, and by 830am it was "closed due to high demand", ok shouldn't be a problem right? I'll just call and tell them that the app was closed, they tell me there's no appointments available. How? Well, they only allow you to make appointments on the day! Unbelievable! So, I'm forced to call or use the app between 7-8am or else I'm out of luck, no healthcare access! Reducing the ability to use the NHS should not be the policy of NHS care providers. 

Sometimes I do make it through though, but I'm often not given care by the correct person. Apparently there's a number of people who are not doctors being given the issues I raise, they call them "clinicians", and I gather that just means those who work at the clinic. They should be honest about who is giving you care because I just assumed that it was GPs since I don't register at a GP surgery to see a nurse or pharmacist about my problems. Nonetheless, if you believe those other than a GP can fix the problem then that's fine, the monkey wrench in the system is that I don't receive proper care and the result is that I'm once again booted back to their unbelievable appointments process. 

Even when I've specifically asked to see a GP and offered to wait for as long as it takes I've been pawned off to one of the other types of clinicians who invariably don't give proper care, meaning they don't solve my issue, which is the whole reason I'm specifically asking for a GP in the first place. 

I was thinking, they need to add the option on the app to say whether or not your issue was solved, if you select "no" and state the reason then it would get moved up the chain to someone more qualified instead of them booting you back to the app where you don't know if you'll get an appointment in the first place. It would eventually lead to you being able to get a GP to address your concern and it would allow the people who are not GPs the opportunity to try to solve the issue along the way, so the medical center still gets to try to keep the GP workload down by using others and the patients still have access to the GP at the end of the process if they still need it because they should always have the choice of being able to see a doctor.

It's incredibly stressful to be forced to only make appointments between 7-8am, especially when you have a medical issue that has not been resolved by previous attempts, it's horrible to open the app to see the response because often you won't have the issue resolved and you have no recourse except doing it all over again and praying it makes it through to someone who can actually help you. It's insomnia inducing because you're so stressed about not missing that window to make appointments with your ongoing medical issue and sometimes you just can't sleep. Accessing your GP shouldn't be like that.

title: Slowly getting back to normal?
body: Just called to get my Covid booster.. quite painless and took just 2 minutes including chat about the procedure…all good.

title: Covid Booster Vaccine - smooth booking process
body:
I booked my Covid booster via Patient Access - online following on from a prompt text message 6 months after my second jab. 

There was plenty of slots available during the Saturday clinic.

I arrived to a queue of about 8 people and was seen to quickly and efficiently.

I was given the vaccine on time exactly and waiting in the waiting area for 15 mins - there was not enough chairs and this was quickly resolved so that everyone was offered a seat.

The vaccine was completely painless.

title: Good
body: Went for COVID booster and flu. Staff friendly and efficient. Dr explained about vaccines and side effects etc before been given the jabs

title: Great practice and staff
body: I have been a patient at this surgery for a number of years. The staff and doctors are very professional and friendly.

title: 111 referral
body: excellent service, seen on time, established no fracture and wound dressed, clear instructions for after care.

title: Life changing
body:
I did leave previous review about waiting time in childrens A&E which I still stand by having waiting 6 and half hours with my daughter but it was worth the wait. The ENT doctor we saw has massively helped my daughter who has been suffering with throat pains on and off for years.
She is finally being listened to and I can say how grateful we are as the team in Ward 16 have been amazing.  They have checked my daughter thoroughly and treated her and also she will have follow up appointments which is so reassuring.  Best thing I did was take my daughter to this hospital thankyou so much.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Shocking Wait Times
body: Still in Hull Royal A&E with a suspected fracture 10 hours after arrival with no end in sight. Desk staff unhelpful will likely timescales. No more clapping from me I'm afraid...

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Good Practice
body: Always Friendly polite efficient - good online referral & advice system - would definitely recommend

title: Brilliant
body: This is one very slick operation, from what I presume was a Security Guard prior to Reception, to the surgeon and the post-op care.  Everyone was so professional and efficient.

title: Hopeless Reception
body:
After being a patient at Beacon for many years, there has been a marked decline in the reception you get.  First of all, you have to wait for an average of 45 minutes before anyone answers.  This varies, and I have known 40 or 50 calls to be waiting ahead of me.  Given an average of 3 minutes per call, that could mean over 2 HOURS waiting on the line, at off-peak times.  The receptionists are usually brusque, unhelpful, uncaring.  This has not always been true, there were some excellent receptionists pre-covid, but they've all left.

For a practice that boasts highest quality healthcare (who says so??) this is not exactly in keeping.  It is a serious error.

title: Fantastic!
body:
I attended yesterday in a great deal of pain. I was treated quickly & efficiently. 
The receptionist was friendly, approachable & professional. The doctor was amazing. From my symptoms he clearly had the diagnosis & a quick examination confirmed. This doctor knew exactly the problem that others would need X-ray/scans to diagnose. I was referred straight to a major hospital with a letter with his findings. 
It’s a shame the major hospital didn’t work the same way. But after 8 hours & diagnostics they arrived at the same result that the brilliant first doctor at gravesend had said in his letter! Absolutely first class service. Thankyou.,

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: New experience
body: I had no idea Health Harmonie were an intermediary, I thought there were a customer processing contact business. I found them extremely professional. But. Is this step to privatisation? I though I was dealing exclusively with the NHS! So, great sevirce from Health Harmonie, proactive, attentive. But is the next step that this is a service I have to pay a fee for, whether I like it or not? Interesting!

title: Efficient Service
body: Flu jabs done … planned and executed very well only problem was limited parking … additional designated parking areas would have helped

title: wonderful, kind, lovely nurses who were so…
body: I think that the nurses go out of their way to make patients feel comfortable and really at ease and make what must be a hard job easier. The department was urogynacology, sorry I have spelt it incorrectly but my friend has taken the paper with her.

title: Great staff but
body: I was called with an appointment time but the line was very bad so had to call back and just kept getting cut off, after trying 75 times, i drive down to the hospital, to get my appointment time, why did no one phone me back when they new i couldn't hear them, then on the way to the appointment i got a call could you come in earlier, so arrived a bit earlier to be told i wasn't on the system and wasn't due in, when i explained I'd just been called to come in early, the receptionist got on the phone and was told i was in and to wait for a nurse to come for me, they told me a new system had just been installed, well all i can say it isn't working but have to say the surgeon and all the medical staff where excellent, should be very proud of them, just sort your communications out.

title: Excellent practice at what is a busy time
body: Unfortunately I tested positive in October for Covid 19, I have completed three different e consults to the surgery, which have all be acknowledged with a couple of hours. I wish to thank the staff at the surgery for excellent service and reassuring me with my worries at what has been a difficult time for me. The support given from the doctors I spoke to has helped me tremendously, i am getting stronger everyday and managing the post covid tiredness. Thanks again for your excellent service.

title: Covid booster and flu jab
body: Attended for Covid booster and flu jab both of which were arranged by staff who contacted me about them being due.

title: Caring practice
body: Attended for flu vaccination. Well organised. Appointment system worked well. It looked as if people could attend without an appointment but we were called through the queue. Parking was limited and one could only access the lower part of the surgery by an entrance on the ground floor. Consequently one had to walk down a steep slope to gain access.

title: Awful Practice, totally inaccessible and helpful
body:
It's impossible to be seen by the GP in this place. You are told to book appointments online and when you try, the application never works. The receptionist is hardly ever willing to help. 

My daughter has been unwell and I was quite distressed. I used a private online service where they recommended an NHS GP to see her in person. After a day of trying, the receptionist finally put us on a queue to be called by a GP. After over 3 hours of waiting for a call, I get a totally unsympathetic doctor who had the audacity to say "I don't understand why the public think seeing a doctor will solve your problem". I was totally and utterly disgusted by this comment. I was a massive supporter of the NHS during the pandemic, but I have to say I absolutely hate it now.

title: Make Booster Appt or Walk in?
body:
Made booster appointment well in advance, upon attendance found a queue of about 100 people.
Nobody I spoke with knew if appointment timings were being followed made way as close as I could get to head of queue, calling out query re. whether appointments still valid, no response, no one appeared to be offering any guidance or control outside premises, door closed.
I didn't want to have to squeeze past people to "queue jump" and knock on door.
Gave up and left without getting booster.
I don't want to discourage any one from getting "jabs" but would simply suggest better signage please.

title: Below Average
body:
I’ve visited this home in October 21. The facade of the building is tired and in need of general maintenance.
The grounds could do with a good tidy. My Aunt was dressed well, her hair was done nice, and looked well cared for. However, there was an element of miscommunication when it come to her dietary requirements. There was also lack of communication between staff and her social worker when it comes to basic needs.

title: Lovely staff
body: I am a fairly new patient and every visit has been great. The reception staff, nurses and Doctors are kind, caring and friendly. I am not the bravest person when it comes to seeing the nurse or GP, so please take this as a huge compliment. Thank you

author: correspondencesk38
title: Great service
body:
At the moment I am being looked after for cancer but in general I cant fault the service we both get, I think the NHS is perfect. Belvoir Health have looked after for the last 59 years.  
Many thanks.

title: Brilliant practice
body: Many years ago my children and I left to go to a closer surgery to where we lived.  We quickly requested to return and were allowed back.  I have no complaints whatsoever and when I hear people talking about problems with their own surgery I can’t compare.  I’ve never failed to get an appointment and think the system/priority works great.  I’m glad you’re addressing the prescription ordering.  My daughter has a monthly repeat and the only way for me to get that at present it to use ask My GP.  I’ve watched the video on linking her account to my NHS App and still can’t do it (and I’m generally good with IT). I do get it in time from ask My GP but think it would be easier on the App.

title: Shocking
body:
Hour long waiting times
Receptionists try anything not to give appointments 
Really poor service
Really irritating

title: Outstanding Outpatient Service
body: I had a referral appt today at 1.45pm in Dermatology to diagnose suspected Carcinomas. I was seen on time, waited 20 mins, then had 2 scraped and 1 incision removal and was back out by 3.15. The service, friendliness, and efficiency from EVERYONE was brilliant. Under the current pressures, a big thank you NHS!!!

title: Good care
body: I have called the practice several times these last few weeks, as I had a persistent cold. A couple of days ago, I called in the morning, had a call back from my GP within two hours. He than decided he needed to see me, went in the same afternoon, blood forms given. The next day after having the blood tests I had a telephone call from my doctor, treatment prescribed, really efficient and caring. I can only praise my GP for his professionalism and care, I am very grateful.

title: Shocking customer service
body: Kept on hold for one and a half hours when finally spoke to a receptionist was asked with no apology and very rude and ignorantly  to ring back at 8am the following day. What sort of customer service is this you provide?? Very incompetent unprofessional staff. Absolutely shocking and extremely surprised this practice was given a good remark from the CQC

title: Local practice
body: The layout was good all the protection was in place, the staff was very helpful, the nursing staff was good, the doctors was first class, overall experience was first class.

title: Terrible
body:
Years of terrible service from this practice. Receprion staff block patients from accessing medical care. 
Since covid things have got worse. 
No care for patients and follow rules so strictly that patients are put at risk.

title: Good service
body: Was dealt with efficiently and felt at ease. Staff was very friendly and also very  helpful with good advice.

title: Dedicated doctor
body: Many thanks to the doctor who phoned me after 7pm on friday for a consultation. I had only requested this the same morning. It is an example of the superb service offered by this practice and the dedication of its staff. .

title: EXCELLENT GP SURGERY, GREAT DOCTORS AND…
body: I had very bad experience from another GP and i switch to this gp and this gp is wonderful. Recommended to everyone to this gp great doctors and friendly staff. Good service and helpfull staff.

title: Very efficient
body: Fast track referral so seen quickly. Easy to park & find my way around. Staff (reception, HCA, consultant and medical secretary) very professional. Had biopsies taken so would have liked more written information on what to expect afterwards, what biopsies were taken and how long the results would take. I ended up googling! Consultant was matter of fact, professional but not terribly reassuring (probably as he didn't want to give false assurances). So basically great service but typical NHS where communication (both written and verbal) to patients needs to improve.  A final shout out to the Medical Secretary who was great when I phoned to chase up, she did everything she said she would. Thanks

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Went for my covid booster and it was quick and efficient with a friendly atmosphere . The doctor and nurse were very professional and asked a few questions before i had the booster . I would recommend them to all my family and friends

title: very arrogant
body:
I came here because it was on the university's web page, but I do regret chosing this clinic.
I had to come here because my hearing aid broke, and since I'm a student, it was a serious loss as it effects all my seminars and lectures. But the doctor was so business like, and after checking all the details, she said "so it's not urgent, right?" 
It's already two month, but I haven't heard anything from NHS. I wonder if they are even doing their job properly.

Contacted 111 with very serious dental issues abscess infection and with having chest pains and shortness of breath along with fever and feeling  lightheaded and generally unwell. After trying all week to get into a dentist with no luck . Surprisingly I got through to 111 relatively quick. However I’ve been waiting 8 hours now for a call back in relation on advice I’m desperately in need of as well as care . It kind of kills the idea of not wanting to call for ambulance or go to AE and waste their time and resources. When a simple call back could quickly point me in the right direction I need. At this rate I can see it being a trip to AE and then being moaned at and told next time go to your gp or manage it at home as it could possibly be treated with prescription meds .

title: Great pratice
body: Very well organised and professional. Reassuring and kind. A wonderful group of practitioners. I feel safe in their hands.

title: Disappointed
body: I rang the surgery over a week ago to ask for a doctors appointment which was made for myself as i needed a blood test form, the appointment was made for yesterday (18th November 2021) i waited for the call no doctor rang me so i called and spoke to Railside today to be told the doctor had done me a form i asked how could he have done that without knowing what i wanted so the woman asked me what i wanted it for so i told her and nope he hadn't put anything on there i wanted (as i hadn't spoken to him about this so how would he know) she said she would have to ask the doctor to put what i wanted on it, i had a call from the doctors which i missed (didn't know they were calling because if i did i would of taken my phone everywhere with me) the woman left me a message asking to call back which i did to be told they would send her a message to call me because she wasn't in that office, didn't get that call so i called back the doctors around 4.45pm to be told the woman had gone home and to ring 8.20am Monday morning because i need to speak to a doctor lol i have no faith anymore. Disappointed and let down is an understatement on how i feel right now.

title: Excellent holistic service
body:
A patient at the pain centre for over 3 years  I'm impressed by the whole patient perspective. From initial Condultant assessment, to psychology mindfulness course, to physiotherapy, to considered and thoughtful prescribing of medication to 
patient  reception and telephone answering, I've received respectful, considerate and caring treatment that  was honest about the limitations of treatment. This level of support motivated me to work to achieve self management of chronic pain.

title: Great support from all staff
body: Yesterday I had a laparoscopy and hystoscopy to investigate and treat my endometriosis. This was my first surgery and I was very nervous. All of the nurse’s, the surgeon and anesthetiser were very friendly, kind, supportive and informative. They were happy to explain exactly what was going to happen and what did happen. They answered ever questions I asked them (and there was a lot). The reassurance and company was brilliant. They listens and helped me when I was in pain and one lovely nurse helped me settle and relax when I came out of the anaesthest. I would love to be able to let them know how amazing they all are

title: I feel so lucky!
body: I am so lucky to have been under this practice since it opened. My children are also registered here. I have never once struggled to get an   appointment and the online system works really well, even though I was sceptical at first. I work for the NHS and very aware of the current pressures the acute hospitals are feeling, the main reason suggested behind this amongst colleagues is due to GPs not seeing patients face to face, well not this Practice, mine and my children’s medical complaints are always dealt with right level of concern. Thank you Holmhurst!

title: Flu Jab 2021
body: So well organised. Clearly set out. Hats off to the helpers. Super staff. You truly are the best surgery.

title: Great service
body: Always willing to see us at a moments notice. Our son seems to be suffering with an ongoing issue and the doctor couldn’t have been more helpful taking samples and referrals to specialist. Really took the time to understand the problems and look for an ongoing solution. Despite how busy it all is we really appreciate the care we received and would always recommend.

title: A safe place for your mental health
body: I was only there a night — but the support I received was unparalleled! They gave me the space to rest and we’re instrumental in my recovery process. It is also a safe place for Queer youth.

readBy.name: Avon and Wiltshire Mental Health Partnership NHS Trust

title: excellent health centre
body: the staff and volunteers were all so helpful and considerate. We especially appreciated the dementia sensitive cafe.

title: Patience and compassion
body:
I have never left a review for a G.P. surgery, but with the pandemic still ongoing and the current political circumstances.
I'm compelled to add my support for Penrhyn surgery.
I have experienced only compassion and a professional manner.
That said, as with all walks of life, you get back what you give.
Be respectful.
The NHS, including our doctors and nurses, are working long hours. They deserve our support and our patience.

title: Excellent caring service.
body:
I would just like to thank everybody in the Gemini Suite at NDDH from bookings through to seeing me safely on my way after treatment.
The staff were so happy , friendly and caring.
Thankyou.  Lyn

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing practice with such lovely people
body: I took my 14 year old son there for a covid vaccination. the system was very efficient with no delays and lovely people working extremely hard. Many thanks to all.

title: Great practice
body: Helpful, approachable, attentive, very quick with response. I appreciate the efficient service that I received

title: Not fit for purpose
body: Called around 5pm took in excess of 30 minutes to be answered, details taken and told a practitioner would call back unable to specify a time just that they really busy, now past 10pm and still no call back.

title: Great Surgery
body: Staff, at all levels, have gone over and above their job descriptions to ensure my recovery from major operation. They have, in their own unique and individual way, demonstrated “care”. I have nothing but the upmost respect for this team

title: No appointments
body:
My wife is suffering from a bad bout of Diverticulitis rang the doctors about it and they said it is a 3 week wait for even a telephone appointment
Ridiculous may end up having to go to a&e

title: Awful service
body: Got a letter to say I'm able to get my booster but get there and they refused me even though I could prove that I'm a carer and disabled too. The doctor would even come over to me me to explain why they are refusing me. Then it took a really long time to check out because I didn't have the booster. The service was awful

title: Review
body: The treatment I received from the time I entered the building to leaving was excellent. From reception staff to the nurses was excellent. Polite, friendly and professional excellent service. It’s a shame my GP at Roby Medical Center can’t do the same.

title: Complement
body: Been today for my booster jab and I would like to say what lovely friend staff and very well organised practice it was (outstanding)

title: Excellent...
body: I attended Heartlands hospital for Vascular surgery in October on Ward 4 the care I received in the 2 days I was there was excellent the nurses could not do enough for you thank you for all your help I received..

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent procedure
body: Attended the Endoscopy department last week for a flexible Sigmoidoscopy. All the staff were wonderful, I couldn't have had a better experience. Thank you all, I'm most grateful.
